abstract.p: Maxxcom Inc, part of MDC Corp, obtains 60 percent of Britain's Interfocus Network after management buyout of Interfocus from Lowe Group; GCI Group acquires Gcom-Kaufmann in Mexico (S)

block.p: Two acquisitions are being made for undisclosed terms.

Maxxcom Inc. in Toronto, part of the MDC Corporation, made its first acquisition in Britain by obtaining a 60 percent stake in Interfocus Network in London, after a management buyout of Interfocus from the Lowe Group, part of the Interpublic Group of Companies.
Two acquisitions are being made for undisclosed terms.

Maxxcom Inc. in Toronto, part of the MDC Corporation, made its first acquisition in Britain by obtaining a 60 percent stake in Interfocus Network in London, after a management buyout of Interfocus from the Lowe Group, part of the Interpublic Group of Companies.

Interfocus has more than 80 employees and billings estimated at $87 million from clients like Eddie Bauer and Microsoft. Matthew Hooper, 36, chairman and chief executive at Interfocus, continues in those posts.

Also, the GCI Group in New York, part of the Grey Global Group, acquired Gcom-Kaufmann in Mexico City, merging it with the GCI Mexico City office. The combined unit, named GCI Mexico, has 52 employees and billings estimated at $1.5 million from clients like Gerber and Procter & Gamble. Oscar Kaufmann, president at Gcom-Kaufmann, becomes managing director at GCI Mexico.
